page.title: 01The Village in the Valley
page.content: Bures sits astride the Suffolk Stour in a valley where road and rail run by the river, in an arable landscape dotted with deciduous trees and water meadows. As road meets river are church, post office, inns and doctors surgery, primary school, antique shops and baptist chapel, food shops and newsagents. Of the 1400 population, many commute to London and East Anglian towns - others work in our cheese factory and agricultural seeds business. Very few work on farms. Silk weaving and light industry employ many. nearby is "Chapel Barn", 13th century private chapel of the De Tanis-now re-consecrated and dedicated to St Stephen, after secular use. It is the legendary site of the coronation of St Edmund, patron saint of England.
